text: Salud salud, glasses clinked around us.
Larks spiraled above dew jewel meadows.
Festival banners rippled above plazas.
Right right, I hear you.
Limestone cliffs towered above coves.

Campfires winked beneath towering pines.
Study study before the big exam.
Fold fold the paper carefully.
Gently, gently rock the cradle to sleep.
Laugh, laugh until your eyes water.
Harbors welcomed crews after months abroad.
Please please take a seat by the window.
Fragrant jasmine drifted along balconies.
Peaks glittered after sudden hailstorms.
Lanterns swayed gently beside river barges.
Murmuring brooks traced winding meadows.
Down down we scrambled the ridge.
Cafes buzzed around lively squares.

Autumn colors dazzled hikers along ridges.
Smile smile for the candid photographer.
Morning frost trimmed every fern frond.
Softly, softly the choir began.
Climb, climb the jagged stair.
Run run, the kids shouted as rain began.
Think think through the problem calmly.
Shadows lengthened over vacant lots.
Mango blossoms scented hillside terraces.
Practice practice every morning before sunrise.

Speak speak, the microphone is on.

Test, test, is this channel clear?
Brave brave souls faced the waves.
Rise, rise above the doubts.
Why why did the gate creak?

Glide glide over frozen ponds.
I said yes, yes to the crazy plan.
Drum drum on the tabletop.

Breathe breathe, the panic will pass.

Spin spin the wheel once more.
Ride ride into the orange dusk.

Bright lights, bright hearts, bright hopes.
Fresh currants stained wicker baskets.

Closer closer, the storm approached.
Wait wait beside the broken sign.

Far far beyond lay hidden dunes.
Busy markets thrummed near harbor warehouses.
Forward forward we marched into snow.
Comets arced across midnight horizons.
Quiet quiet, owls hunt nearby.
Kites circled lazily over cliff villages.
Whirr whirr, the fan spun faster.
Amber lichens freckled granite outcrops.
Distant thunder rolled across valleys.
Eat, eat before the bell rings.
Shine shine, little beacons in fog.
Drift drift across the open lake.
Crack crack chased the lightning.
Now now, remember your lines.
Bamboo groves rustled during monsoon.
Cathedral bells tolled across districts.
Steady, steady hands guided the rope.
Coffee, coffee kept the coder awake.
Tin cups clattered against wooden benches.

Never, never underestimate a quiet ally.

Pilgrims trudged along dusty causeways.

Sail sail before the tide turns.

Focus focus or you will slip.
Listen listen to the old mapmaker.

Plan plan, then execute with care.
Sprout sprout after warm rain.
Caravans trekked across sunbaked flats.
Dance dance beneath lanterns tonight.

Chirp chirp under the hedge.
Balance balance on the narrow beam.
Dig dig until the roots show.
Carriages rattled beyond iron gates.

Move, move your bike off the path.
